definition: Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This book is one of the most important ones in the research of Confucius Analects by the Qing sinologists.
sentences.chinese: 《論語考異》是清代漢學家研究《論語》的扛鼎之作。

sentences.english: Many directors of the Confucius Institutes are also Sinologists.
sentences.chinese: 許多孔子學院的院長就是漢學家。

sentences.english: Yang Yuanhong to direct the poetry. and sinologist Bunn TON.
sentences.chinese: 與漢學家霍布恩先生切磋。

sentences.english: Malmqvist is the sole sinologist among the eighteen members of the Swedish Academy .
sentences.chinese: 馬悅然是瑞典皇家學院十八位院士中唯一的漢學家。

sentences.english: As a sinologist, Stephen Owen is famous for his works on classical Chinese literature.
sentences.chinese: 宇文所安是以中國古典文學研究而聞名的漢學家。

sentences.english: The thesis penetrates into the translation principles and the translations of the three British sinologists.
sentences.chinese: 本文重點探討三位英國漢學家的譯學與譯作。

sentences.english: The thesis begins with a basic introduction to the three sinologists.
sentences.chinese: 本文先介紹三位漢學家的基本情況。

pinyin: Ge1 lun2 bi3 ya4 Da4 xue2

definition: Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China

pinyin: Pu3 lin2 si1 dun4 Da4 xue2

definition: sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
Confucius Institute, organization established internationally by the PRC, promoting Chinese language and culture
